newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy metalworkers strike for new contract.
newsitem.headline: Italy metalworkers strike for new contract.

text.p: Italian engineering and metalworkers went on strike on Friday to press demands for a new contract.
Negotiations for a renewal of contracts broke down earlier this month.
Unions representing some 1.5 million workers have demanded an overall wage rise of 10.1 percent over the next two years, while employers had offered between seven and nine percent.
The eight-hour stoppage is the sector's first nationwide strike over contracts since November 1990.
Leaders of Italy's large trade unions were due to address rallies of striking workers in the northern cities of Milan, Turin and Padua.
